sources.autograph: Lucca, Istituto Musicale Boccherini, D.I.33, 'Sonata a quattro no. 3...' (for comment, see No. 159)
ms_copies_score: Lucca, Istituto Musicale Boccherini, B.I 114, 'Sonata a quattro no. 3...'
ms_copies_parts: Montecatini, Venturi private collection, A.9, 'Quartetto no. 3...'

continues_from_previous.first_edition: 1953, Milan, Ricordi: Op. 1 no. 1 (pocket score; revised by Enrico Polo)

arrangements.description: Of the whole quartet, as a sonata for harpsichord (or pianoforte or harp) and violin, perhaps by Naderman, c. 1778 (see No. 43)
Of the third movement, as part of a sonata for harpsichord (or pianoforte) and violin, by 'Mlle Le Jeune', c. 1785 (see No. 46)

partial_notes: Entry 159 continues from previous page with publication and arrangement information. Entry 160 appears complete on this page.
